BugInstance.message: new com.udacity.catpoint.security.application.ControlPanel(SecurityService, SensorPanel) may expose internal representation by storing an externally mutable object into ControlPanel.securityService
new com.udacity.catpoint.security.application.ControlPanel(SecurityService, SensorPanel) may expose internal representation by storing an externally mutable object into ControlPanel.sensorPanel
Do not catch NullPointerException like in com.udacity.catpoint.security.application.ImagePanel.lambda$new$0(ActionEvent)
new com.udacity.catpoint.security.application.ImagePanel(SecurityService) may expose internal representation by storing an externally mutable object into ImagePanel.securityService
new com.udacity.catpoint.security.application.SensorPanel(SecurityService) may expose internal representation by storing an externally mutable object into SensorPanel.securityService

Exception thrown in class com.udacity.catpoint.security.data.PretendDatabaseSecurityRepositoryImpl at new com.udacity.catpoint.security.data.PretendDatabaseSecurityRepositoryImpl() will leave the constructor. The object under construction remains partially initialized and may be vulnerable to Finalizer attacks.
com.udacity.catpoint.security.data.PretendDatabaseSecurityRepositoryImpl.getSensors() may expose internal representation by returning PretendDatabaseSecurityRepositoryImpl.sensors

new com.udacity.catpoint.security.service.SecurityService(SecurityRepository, FakeImageService) may expose internal representation by storing an externally mutable object into SecurityService.securityRepository

Primitive field com.udacity.catpoint.security.service.SecurityService.isCatDetected is public and set from inside the class, which makes it too exposed. Consider making it private to limit external accessibility.
Switch statement found in com.udacity.catpoint.security.service.SecurityService.handleSensorActivated() where default case is missing
